intro: Polygala oxyphylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaved milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish in color, and it produces small, bead-like fruits. Polygala oxyphylla is often found in open habitats such as shrublands and grasslands.
